a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Various measures of child labor incidence, 1851 to 2012
The series World ILO-EPEAP, as well as the series for England and Italy, cover working children aged 10-14. The
series for the US covers working children aged 10-13. The series World ILO-IPEC covers children aged 5-17.
Data source: England: Cunningham, H. and Viazzo, P.P. (1996); Italy: Tonioli and Vecchi (2007); US: Long (1958); World (1950-1995):
International Labor Organisation Programme on Estimates and Projections on the Elimination of of Child Labor (ILO-EPEAP). Basu,
1999; World (2000-2012): International Labor Organisation Programme on the Elimination of Child Labor (ILO-IPEC). ILO, 2013.
